Brazilian.title: Feijoada
Brazilian.instructions: Drain soaked beans. In a large pot, combine beans, pork shoulder, bacon, sausage, beef ribs, onions, garlic, bay leaves, cumin, paprika, black pepper, and salt. Add enough water to cover ingredients by 2 inches. Bring to boil, then simmer for 2-3 hours until meat is tender and beans are soft. Remove bay leaves. Serve hot with orange slices and farofa.

Brazilian.title: Moqueca de Peixe
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Brazilian.instructions: Layer onions, tomatoes, and bell peppers in a large pot. Place fish fillets on top. Add garlic, olive oil, coconut milk, lime juice, palm oil, coriander, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes until fish is cooked through. Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with rice.

Brazilian.title: Pão de Queijo
Brazilian.instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Heat milk and olive oil in a saucepan until warm. In a large bowl, mix tapioca flour, eggs, Parmesan cheese, salt, and baking powder. Gradually add warm milk mixture, stirring until smooth. Let dough rest for 15 minutes. Form into small balls and place on baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden and puffed. Serve warm.

Brazilian.title: Brigadeiro
Brazilian.instructions: In a saucepan, combine condensed milk, cocoa powder, and butter. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and pulls away from pan, about 10-15 minutes. Let cool completely. Roll into small balls and coat with chocolate sprinkles. Refrigerate until firm. Serve at room temperature.

Brazilian.title: Caipirinha
Brazilian.instructions: In a glass, muddle lime wedges with sugar. Add cachaça and ice cubes. Stir well and serve immediately.

Argentine.title: Asado
Argentine.instructions: Season beef and sausages with salt, pepper, oregano, and paprika. Let marinate for 2 hours. Heat grill to medium-high heat. Brush meat with olive oil. Grill beef ribs for 20-25 minutes, flank steak for 8-10 minutes per side, and sausages for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally. Let meat rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve hot with chimichurri sauce.

Argentine.title: Empanadas
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Argentine.instructions: Mix flour, butter, water, egg, and salt to make dough. Chill for 30 minutes. For filling, cook ground beef with onion until browned. Add chopped eggs, olives, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Roll out dough and cut into circles. Place filling in center and fold over. Seal edges with fork. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes until golden. Serve hot.

Argentine.title: Chimichurri
Argentine.instructions: Finely chop parsley and oregano. In a bowl, combine herbs, garlic, vinegar, olive oil, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. Let stand for 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Serve with grilled meats.

Argentine.title: Dulce de Leche
Argentine.instructions: Remove label from can of condensed milk. Place can in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to boil, then simmer for 3 hours, adding water as needed to keep can covered. Let cool completely. Open can and stir in vanilla and salt. Serve as a spread or dessert.

Argentine.title: Mate
Argentine.instructions: Fill mate gourd 2/3 full with yerba mate. Tilt gourd and add a small amount of cold water to moisten leaves. Insert bombilla (metal straw). Add hot water (160-180°F) and let steep for 1-2 minutes. Add sugar if desired. Sip through bombilla. Refill with hot water as needed.

Peruvian.title: Peruvian Ceviche
ingredients: 500g fresh white fish, cut into cubes
Peruvian.instructions: Place fish in a glass bowl. Add lime juice, lemon juice, onion, chili, cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mix gently and refrigerate for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Fish should be opaque and 'cooked' by the citrus juice. Serve on lettuce leaves with sweet potato and corn on the side.

Peruvian.title: Lomo Saltado
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Peruvian.instructions: Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Stir-fry beef in batches until browned, about 2-3 minutes per batch. Remove and set aside. Stir-fry onions and garlic for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Return beef to wok. Add soy sauce, vinegar, aji amarillo, salt, and pepper. Stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add cilantro. Serve hot with French fries and rice.

Peruvian.title: Aji de Gallina
Peruvian.instructions: Poach chicken in water until cooked through. Shred chicken and set aside. Heat oil in a large pot. Sauté onions and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add aji amarillo paste and cook for 2 minutes. Add evaporated milk, chicken stock, walnuts, and cheese. Simmer for 10 minutes until thickened. Add shredded chicken and heat through. Garnish with egg slices and olives. Serve hot with rice.

Peruvian.title: Pisco Sour
Peruvian.instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine pisco, lime juice, simple syrup, and egg white. Dry shake (without ice) for 30 seconds. Add ice and shake again for 30 seconds. Strain into chilled glass. Garnish with drops of bitters on top.

Peruvian.title: Alfajores
Peruvian.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Mix flour, cornstarch, butter, sugar, egg yolks, vanilla, baking powder, and salt to make dough. Chill for 30 minutes. Roll out dough and cut into circles. Bake for 12-15 minutes until golden. Let cool completely. Spread dulce de leche on half the cookies. Top with remaining cookies. Dust with powdered sugar.

Colombian.title: Bandeja Paisa
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Colombian.instructions: Cook rice according to package directions. Season pork chops with salt and pepper and grill until cooked through. Form ground beef into patties and grill. Grill chorizo sausages. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Fry plantain slices until golden. Arrange all components on a large platter: rice, beans, pork chops, beef patties, chorizo, eggs, avocado, plantains, and hogao sauce. Serve hot.

Colombian.title: Arepas
Colombian.instructions: Mix cornmeal, water, salt, and butter to form a smooth dough. Let rest for 10 minutes. Form dough into 8 equal balls. Flatten each ball into 1/2-inch thick discs. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook arepas for 5-7 minutes per side until golden and crispy. Serve hot with butter, cheese, or as a side dish.

Colombian.title: Ajiaco
ingredients: 200g corn on the cob, cut into pieces
Salt and black pepper to taste
Colombian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Brown chicken on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside. Sauté onions and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Return chicken to pot. Add potatoes, corn, bay leaves, cumin, salt, and pepper. Add enough water to cover ingredients. Bring to boil, then simmer for 1 hour until chicken is tender and potatoes are soft. Stir in heavy cream. Garnish with capers and cilantro. Serve hot.

Colombian.title: Hogao
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Colombian.instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté onions and garlic until softened, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, cumin, and paprika. Cook for 10-15 minutes until mixture thickens. Add cilantro, salt, and pepper. Cook for additional 2 minutes. Serve as a condiment with Colombian dishes.

Colombian.title: Tres Leches Cake
Colombian.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Mix flour, baking powder, and salt. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat egg yolks with sugar until pale. Fold in flour mixture and milk. Gently fold in egg whites. Pour into greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden. Let cool completely. Mix evaporated milk, condensed milk, and heavy cream. Pour over cake and refrigerate for 4 hours. Whip remaining heavy cream with powdered sugar. Spread over cake and serve chilled.
